decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing numbers: Block Plan, Proposed Floor Plan, 	MR-R00-EX-102 (Existing Plans), MR-R00-EX-101 (Location Map), MR-R00-PR-103 (Site Plan), MR-R00-PR-102 (Proposed Plans), Cover Letter dated 12/04/2023, Change of use Confirmation Letter dated 22/06/2023, Transport and Parking Management Statement dated 29/06/2023.

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | Notwithstanding the details shown on the approved plans, no windows or other openings (other than those shown on the submitted plans) shall be formed in the walls or roof of the buildings.

Reason: To protect residential amenity in accordance with policies 1.1, 1.2 & 3.8 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D4 of the London Plan (2021), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021). | Two (2) short-stay cycle parking spaces shall be provided within the curtilage of the development. The short-stay cycle parking spaces shall be within secure, lockable compound in accordance with all adopted standards prior to the first use of the extension hereby approved. The cycle spaces shall be permanently retained thereafter.

Reason: To provide adequate bicycle storage in accordance with policy Ealing's sustainable transport SPD and T5 of the London Plan (2021). | The hours of operation of the minicab office shall be restricted to 07:00 until 00:00hrs Monday to Friday and no walk-in bookings/members of the public shall be permitted in the premises.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise from activities or people attending the site, in accordance with Policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D14 of The London Plan (2021), Ealing SPG10 Noise and Vibration and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021) - sections 2 and 12, London Plan Standard 30 of the Housing SPG and Policy 7.15. | Car parking shall be managed in accordance with the submitted Transport and Parking Management Statement.

Reason: To promote sustainable patterns of transport, and to limit the impact of the proposal on local parking and highway conditions, in accordance with policies T3, T4, T5 and T6 of the London Plan 2021, Policies 1.1, 1.2, 3.1, 3.4 and 6.4 of the Development (Core) Strategy (2012) and policy LV6.13 of the adopted Ealing Development Management DPD (2013).
description: Change of use of the ground floor (Use Class E) to Use Class Sui Generis to accomodate a minicab office and barber shop.
